alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 2:22PM CDT until April 20 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN HANCOCK...SOUTHWESTERN HENDERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN LEE COUNTIES... At 221 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Keokuk Airport, or near Keokuk, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Montrose, Galland, Sandusky, Camp Eastman and Bluff Park around 225 PM CDT. Nauvoo and Nauvoo State Park around 230 PM CDT. Fort Madison, Ferris and Niota around 235 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Colusa, Adrian, Dallas City, Pontoosuc, Disco, Lomax, La Harpe, Carman, Terre Haute, Shokokon, Decorra and Hopper. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. If a tornado or other severe weather is spotted, report it to the National Weather Service or your local nearest law enforcement agency who will send your report. This act may save lives of others in the path of dangerous weather.
